title: Gradski ured za gospodarstvo, energetiku i zaštitu okoliša - Eko Zagreb
translated_content:
\R\n
The legislative reform of the energy sector in the Republic of Croatia began in 2001 with the adoption of: The Energy Act, the Electricity Market Act, the Gas Market Act, the Oil and Petroleum Products Market Act and the Act on the Regulation of Energy Activities.
\R\n
\NIN addition to these regulations, the obligations of the City of Zagreb in the fields of energy and energy management, but also environmental protection, are now regulated in Croatia by a number of other laws and regulations, and the process of bringing Croatian legislation into line with the EU acquis is ongoing.
\R\n
\R\nThe competence, scope and tasks of this Office in the fields of energy, energy management and energy sustainable development and environmental protection are determined primarily by energy laws, adopted strategies, implementing regulations and regulations.
\R\n\r\n \r\n\t\t\t\t\t

\R\n
OpÄenite health recommendations for residents of the City of Zagreb in sluÄa’s povio — Äestica (PM)
\N
\nDuring the winter months, uobiÄa was the occurrence of reduced air quality due to the sows of the Äestica lebdeÄih Äestica in the air.The causes are numerous, such as the VeÄi number of kuÄni and industrial loÅ predominantly, road traffic, weather conditions, etc.
\N
\nThe injection of air from the lebdeÄim Äestice, uobiÄa, at that time of the year, is not a remarkable threat to human health. However, with a view to reducing health risks, we make the following recommendations for vulnerable groups of graÄana for preventive purposes, in order to adapt their daily activities to the current state of air quality:
\N
\nThe following shall be consulted:
\N
\N• Avoiding long-term and intensive outdoor physical activity, especially along roads, for the following groups of graÄana:
\nno children,
\nno pregnant woman,
\nn the elderly of the Å¾ivo age,
\no people suffering from chronicÄ diseases at the level of the diÅ constituents and/or srÄano-krvoÅ¼il system,
\nno person naruÅproducing an immunological response
\no, also persons who consume tobacco and tobacco related products (puÅ-aÄi and passive puÅproducingaÄi).
\N• the use of prescribed medicinal products for persons with acute and kronitric symptoms, and the traÅ¼e advice given by the beautites of the primary health care centre for ÅÄtite in the sluÄa pogorÅņa or the extension of the duration of the symptoms at the level of the diÅņan or srÄano-krvoÅ¾il system;
\N• avoid unnecessary additional isolations of Äes by respirable Äes from other sources, such as scaffolding, crust of Åproducing chemicals, adhesives, paints, varnishes, etc.,
\N• the corrigenda of urban public transport;
\N• avoidance/reduction of heating using solid fuels.
\N
\nHealth preventive recommendations are also issued in the worms of the UV-index, low and high air temperatures, adverse biometeoroloÅ-effects, and the peaks of the totality of allergenic pollen in the air for the purpose of informing graÄan, in order to adapt their daily activities to the current conditions of the surroundings of theÅ judgement.
\N

\nThe local health office, in cooperation with the teaching institute of public health ‘Dr. Andrija Å tampar’, monitors air quality at the Mirogojska measurement station 16, namely the concentration of the following: duÅ prescribes monoxide (NO), duÅ-nico dioxide (NO2), carbon monoxide (CO), sulphur dioxide (SO2), and ground-level ozone (O3).

The Rules entered into force on 1 January 2013.

title: Grad Zagreb službene stranice
translated_content:
\R

\R
 
 


 


\Non Sunday, at a cross-breeding of the new Oporovečka and Konjščinska, a panel was discovered bearing the name of the Croatian defence lawyer Rudolf Kolak who died, giving her street name, which is separated from Goika Šuška avenue (south from KBC Dubrav) in a north-east direction and exits in Dankko.
\N

At a company with the Mayor of Milan Bandić and President of the Assembly, Davor Bernardić, and in the presence of many citizens, co-committees and families, the honour to uncover a tab bearing the name of Major Kolaka was given to his mother Kati Kolak.
\N

with the exception of the avenue of Goika Šuška, which we have jointly chosen to continue to bear this name, we now have a street with the name of another Croatian hero from the Homeland War, Major Rudi Kolaka, he stressed at the ceremony of Mayor Bandić, adding that we must always nurture and pay respect to all those who had placed their lives in the oltar of the homeland.
\N

When heard, Rudolf Kolak fought in all Croatian warfields since 1990 as the first Croatian orderer and then as a member of the Special Police, the legendary 1st Guard Brigade Tigrovi, the 8th easy-jury brigade of the Military Police and the 1st Croatian Guard Association. He was also awarded the highest military awards in the Homeland War of Merit.
\N

After the discovery of the plate, the programme was continued in the Dubrava sports hall at the final dinner 8 of the memorial-humanitarian tournament.

title: Grad Zagreb službene stranice
translated_content:
\R\n
The Mayor of Milan Bandić, in the presence of the participants of the project, representatives of the city institutions and the author of the design of the tiles, symbolically set number plates on the façade of the buildings in Mesničko 1 and Yurišić’s 1a, starting with the implementation of the Project of a new street name labelling system for streets, stores and buildings in Zagreb.
\NIN the old kernel of the city, the tile is white with a red edge and dark blue inscription, and maintained an authentic appearance as it is already existing, whose design encourages it from the time of Austro-Hungarian monarchy.
\N\n
The task we have carried out for the last 13 years has been to change Zagreb on a daily basis, while keeping the same, keeping his champion and beauty. Following this, all experts, art historians agreed to be authentic in the old kernel of the tiles, explained the Mayor of Bandić.
\nThe rest of the city will have blue plates with a white inscription, the authors of Nikola Đurk and Damir Bralić, who have developed a completely new Ilica typography, which can also be used exclusively for this purpose.
\nThe Mayor underlined that in addition to aesthetic value, the new labelling system aims to improve the visibility and functionality of citizens, service and emergency services, who often have problems in finding an address, and tourists who are growing in our city every year. In this way, Zagreb will achieve the standard it deserves as a European metropolis.
\N\n
In order to make it easier for citizens to opt for replacement and speed up the entire project, the City of Zagreb will co-finance the purchase and installation of tiles in a ratio of 50:50 per cent. In this way, citizens in the Old City Center will pay HRK 153.12 for the plate, while in the rest of the area the price of a tile is HRK 48.75.
\nThe project will have a duration of 4 years and is planned in 2013, as announced by Doris Kažimir, project coordinator, to equip the building, family houses and business premises on the premises of four neighbourhoods: Lower town, Upper City — Medveščka, Trinje and Trešnjevka North, which is around 16 000 official addresses, i.e. numbers.
